page.title: 16RECREATION.
page.content: Most Pubs in Somerset have skittle alleys. I have played in one out of doors, against bales of straw. The formation is one small pin at the front, then two more behind, then another two with a big skittle in the middle, then another two, then one. The object is to knock down as many as possible of the nine pins with three balls which are usually rough.The floors are usually quite uneven. Some people can get all the pins down in one or two shots and are then allowed to have another go. {By John W. Pendleton.} Our village has a playing field with a pavilion used by the local football and cricket clubs. The school plays football and rounders there. There is also a rugby club near the A 38,a nearby road.
